intro: Bayabusua, commonly known as the sacred tree of the Yucatec Maya, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Yucatán Peninsula. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The tree produces long, pod-like fruits that contain edible seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils near rivers and in humid lowland areas. Due to its cultural and ecological significance, it is considered a keystone species in its native habitat.
